'Bar' colour for tasks having no colour
'Stack' comments above (or left of) edit fields
'Stack' edit fields and comments when they occupy the same position (left, right or below)
(Note: You should only use this option if you are certain that the incoming tasks will have the correct task IDs)
-ab <alloc by>\tSets the 'Allocated By' for the currently selected task
-at <alloc to>\tSets the 'Allocated To' for the currently selected task
-bid <task id>\tSpecifies the sibling task below which to create the new task
-c <categories>\tSets the 'Categories' for the currently selected task
-ca <attribute id> <attribute value>\tSets the value for the specified custom attribute ID for the currently selected task
-cd <date>\tSets the 'Completion Date' for the currently selected task
-cm <comments>\tAdds to the 'Comments' for the currently selected task
-cmd <id>\tSends the specified command to ToDoList's main window
-copy <attrib1> <attrib2>\tCopies the value for 'attrib1' to 'attrib2' for the currently selected task
-cs <cost>\tSets the 'Cost' for the currently selected task
-ct <time>\tSets the 'Completion Time' for the currently selected task
-dd <date>\tSets the 'Due Date' for the currently selected task
-dp <id>\tSets the 'Dependencies' for the currently selected task
-dt <time>\tSets the 'Due Time' for the currently selected task
-e\tStarts ToDoList without reloading any previously open tasklists
-fr <path>\tSets the 'File Link' for the currently selected task
-h, -help, -?\tDisplays a message box showing all the available commandline options
-ic <icon name/number>\tSets the 'Icon' for the currently selected task
-l <task link>\tOpens the specified tasklist and selects the specified task
-md <date>\tSets the 'Creation Date' of the newly created task
-mp\tUses the password of the first decrypted tasklist as a master password for decrypting subsequent tasklists. Requires password prompting to be turned off (-x)
-mt <time>\tSets the 'Creation Time' of the newly created task
-nt <title>\tCreates a new task in the active tasklist with the specified title
-p <priority>\tSets the 'Priority' for the currently selected task
-pc <percentage>\tSets the 'Percentage Completion' for the currently selected task
-pid <task id>\tSpecifies the parent task in which to create the new task
-r <risk>\tSets the 'Risk' for the currently selected task
-s <status>\tSets the 'Status' for the currently selected task
-sd <date>\tSets the 'Start Date' for the currently selected task
-st <time>\tSets the 'Start Time' for the currently selected task
-te <hrs>\tSets the 'Time Estimate' for the currently selected task
-tg <tags>\tSets the 'Tags' for the currently selected task
-tid <task id>\tSelects the specified task in the active tasklist
-tp <prefix>\tApplies a prefix to the application title
-ts <hrs>\tSets the 'Time Spent' for the currently selected task
-tt <title>\tSets the 'Title' for the currently selected task
-tv <version>\tSets the 'Version' for the currently selected task
-v\tForces ToDoList to startup visible regardless of its last saved state
-x\tTurns off password prompting except when first loading an encrypted tasklist
-xid <ext_id>\tSets the 'external ID' for the currently selected task
-z\tStores attribute visibility settings within each tasklist
0 (zero) is not a valid task ID
